titleStmt.title: TCM10: TEI Council Conference Call 29 Mar 04
titleStmt.author: Syd Bauman

publicationStmt.p: For distribution first to Council, then to world via TEI website.

sourceDesc.p: This electronic file is the source.

div.p: Times are UTC unless otherwise noted.
Started 13:06 with NS, DD, JF, MD, PW, SS, EV, SB, LB, SR, AB, CW; DB @ 13:34 after having been stuck in an elevator.

list.item: SR reports Roma development list has been established and seen a little traffic.

CW believes Sanskritters will be able to deliver something for P5. They have been convinced to be a bit more general. Interesting note: they have independently invented choice. CW Liaison with Sanskritters and request that they prepare at least a report, if not deliverables, for Council meeting in May. none assigned
CW reports that he has reconsider item 8 from previous meeting, and thinks we should not in fact set up a joint committee. No one disagreed.
Only META asked for funding, or at least took it.

div.head: CE
div.p:
CW reports little progress on Ch. 4, pending input from MB.
SB Get MB's phone # from LB, and attempt phone contact. none assigned WG is almost done with what is called CEW06. All seem to think this one is going very well. Credits particularly to LB and M. Duerst. Group still needs a good name for what is currently called WSD-NG.

div.head: SO
div.p:
DD has been the bottleneck. Agrees in principle with suggestion from SB over the weekend. Lou — were I writing these minutes I'd post my mail to TEI-SOM, then provide a pointer to it for Council. Let me know if you want me to go ahead with that idea. Would like to set up meetings with SB. SB agreed to idea. LB suggests we need a fall back plan. FV was only suggestion. Thus, SB & DD to meet regularly and use work-plan SB sent to LB & DD over weekend. LB and JF to oversee, as it were. DD Post to TEI-SOM new plan of action ASAP
SB & DD Write up draft of main XPointer recommendations 2004-04-06
SB & DD Write up draft of main portions of SO W 03 2004-05-06

div.head: FS
div.p: Was doing very well; good meeting in Nancy; even better one in Korea. Some dissension occurred when question of re-entrancy or shared structures came up. Not solved. Waiting for more input and discussion within group. ISO intending a list of current implementations. Since we'll have list, we can notify folks about P4 to P5 changes.
Group will meet informally at LREC in late May; formally in late Aug. At least LB, probably SB, will need to be funded to this latter meeting. No WG funding for former.
DD notes that why changes made and implications thereof not clear in FSW01. LB responds that this document is intended to be read in conjunction with the draft chapter.

div.head: MS
div.p: WG has mostly been waiting for LB to get Master DTD into RelaxNG, which is just now done. DB raises issue of TF v WG. Basic plan is for current group to work out Reykjavik proposals by May Council meeting, then consider expansion & face-to-face. MS WG Finish up work begun in Reykjavik 2004-05-06

div.head: ME
div.p: ODD language itself revised again in Paris. TD will be ready to discuss in May. Implementation except for extensions essentially done. Extensions will take longer.
Extensions will also cover needs of internationalization. Web interface will need work and likely take longer, too.
SR hopes work of TF can be declared done in May. &what;
Question of how Guidelines should recommend users actually create extensions.
LB points out that this (TD) is probably the most important thing for Council members to tackle and have a good understanding of. SB agrees.

SB recommends either TD become more tutorial-like or a separate tutorial be written. JF suggests perhaps WWP Guide, which will cover this anyway, might serve a lay audience. SR suggests TM, LB suggests AB, do so. AB says he will most likely not have time to commit to this project.
SR plans to have a couple of simple extensions available for Council in May.

div.head: PB
div.p: Main goal of group is to develop encoding for collation formula. Discussion on how PB and MS may or may not overlap. LB points out that work of PB could perhaps be plugged into MS.

DB Send the work he has done on collation sequence encoding for his own manuscript project to PB (i.e., JF or TC). ASAP
SB, JF, & DB to meet in mid-April in Providence.
ACTION: JF write charge by DB's trip here (16 Apr).

JF Write draft of PB WG charge. 2004-04-15
JF hopes also to spur, if not produce, a list of related issues that need to be tackled.
Wrapped up at 14:23 with information that Members' Meeting will be at John's Hopkins on 22 & 23 Oct. MD will be doing a workshop there in April.
SS requests that documents for next meeting be on website well before meeting. All agreed to 06 May.
EV will investigate group hotel rates, but doesn't have much hope.
